name: nom
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used for showing that you like a particular kind of food or that you think something looks or sounds very good to eat: Carrot cake muffins with a light cream cheese icing. Nom! I love toffee popcorn—nom nom. Oh nom nom nom, that sandwich looks so good!

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Pleasant to eat or drink
nom noun
(SUGGESTION)
[ C ] a nomination (= an official suggestion for a prize, position, or job): He's a superb actor—I can't believe this is his first Oscar nom. I wonder if he is pushing for the Dem nom?

Suggestions & proposals
nom noun
(FOOD)
[ C or U ] mainly UK (US usually num nums) food: The supermarkets have a good variety of international nom. I'll definitely pop into that bar one day for a cocktail and some noms. Here's your favourite num nums!
See also
nom de guerre
nom de plume
nom verb
(SUGGEST)
[ T ] to suggest something or someone officially for a prize, position, or job: The drama was nommed for an Emmy award. It was BAFTA's choice to nom her for Best Actress.

nom verb
(EAT)
[ I or T ] to eat something, especially in a way that shows you are enjoying what you are eating: The toddler was very happily nomming her dinner. I'm about to nom on (= eat) a table full of crayfish.
